DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease response in a non-target lesion, using Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (iRECIST).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Non-Target Lesion Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._Other than the one for which something is done._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: Other than the one for which something is done.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Other than the one for which something is done.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI CRF standards task. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used._The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.longName: Non iRECIST Complete Response-Non iRECIST Unconfirmed Progressive Disease
Concepts.definition: Persistence of one or more non-target lesion(s) without unequivocal progression following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

Concepts.definition: Apparent radiographic progression which requires confirmation, per criteria, with additional imaging.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

Concepts.definition: Radiographic progression which has been confirmed by additional imaging showing worsening of initial progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer following an initial apparent radiographic progression.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

Concepts.definition: Not all target lesions were assessed. Or not all non-target lesions were assessed.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated Long Name and Definition to match current NCIt. mc 4/27/2020

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Non-Target Lesion Identification Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
The identification of a lesion that is not considered a target lesion but may be affected by the therapeutic intervention.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
